video.title: Ken Burns: The Civil War
video.synopsis: Ken Burns's documentary depicts the action of famous Civil War battles, and relates the stories of soldiers, generals and a beleaguered president.

episodes.synopsis: Beginning with an examination of slavery, this episode looks at the causes of the war and the burning questions of union and states' rights.
episodes.title: The Cause (1861)

episodes.synopsis: The year 1862 saw the birth of modern warfare and the transformation of Lincoln's war to preserve the Union into a war to emancipate the slaves.
episodes.title: A Very Bloody Affair (1862)

episodes.synopsis: Convinced by July 1862 that emancipation was morally and militarily crucial to the Union, Lincoln must wait for a victory to issue his proclamation.
episodes.title: Forever Free (1862)

episodes.synopsis: This episode begins with the nightmarish Union disaster at Fredericksburg and follows clashes at Chancellorsville and Vicksburg in 1863.
episodes.title: Simply Murder (1863)

episodes.synopsis: The Battle of Gettysburg was the greatest ever fought in the Western Hemisphere. For three days, 150,000 clashed in the Pennsylvania countryside.
episodes.title: The Universe of Battle (1863)

episodes.synopsis: This episode compares Grant and Lee and then chronicles the extraordinary series of battles that pitted the two generals against each.
episodes.title: Valley of the Shadow of Death (1864)

episodes.synopsis: The presidential campaign of 1864 set Abraham Lincoln against his old general, George McClellan. The stakes are the survival of the Union itself.
episodes.title: Most Hallowed Ground (1864)

episodes.synopsis: William Tecumseh Sherman's March to the Sea brings war to the heart of Georgia and the Carolinas and spells the end of the Confederacy.
episodes.title: War Is All Hell (1865)

episodes.synopsis: Five days after Lee's surrender at Appomattox, Lincoln is assassinated. See the final days of the war and the fates of the series's major figures.
episodes.title: The Better Angels of Our Nature (1865)
